meanings.definition: A person who worries or is anxious about something.
meanings.sent1: My friend is one of the worriers in our group, always fretting about little things.
meanings.sent2: The worriers in the office were constantly checking and rechecking their work.
meanings.sent3: The worriers at the picnic brought umbrellas even though the weather forecast was sunny.
meanings.sent4: She was a worrier by nature, always imagining the worst-case scenarios.
meanings.sent5: The worriers in the movie were portrayed as comically paranoid characters.

meanings.definition: Those who are prone to feeling anxious or concerned about potential problems.
meanings.sent1: The worriers in the family always made sure to have a backup plan for every event.
meanings.sent2: As the deadline approached, the worriers in the group started to panic.
meanings.sent3: The worriers in the class were the first to raise their hands when the teacher asked if anyone had questions.
meanings.sent4: The worriers in the neighborhood were known for their excessive preparation for any emergency.
meanings.sent5: The worriers in the story were always anticipating the worst outcomes.
